1. Stocatree User GuideÂ¶

Simulated apple tree using Stocatree in LPy (python version of MAppleT)

Openalea.StocaTree is a Python package that provide a Lsystem dedicated to simulation of apple trees over several years, by taking into account statistical properties and bio-mechanics. It is based on an original model developed by Colin Smith, which is called MAppleT [ref1] . This model is made of a C++ library and a Lsystem to be used within LStudio.

OpenAlea.StocaTree provides a Lsystem (in python) to be used with VPlants.Lpy, a Python implementation of L-Studio. The advantage of Stocatree is to provide a multi-platform version of MAppleT.

The main goals of stocatree:

  • show the feasibility of large L-system implementation in LPy, which is currently done (e.g., see Results section)

  • Update and improve Stocatree with respect to the original MAppleT code by
    • making the statistical models more realistic
    • making the biomechanical model faster and reusable by other models
    • including light interception
